item.title: Clicking Object and Making Item Appear
item.dc:creator: @hadesflames hadesflames
item.description:
@hadesflames wrote:

case 6420: if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(6754,1)){ c.getItems().deleteItem(6754, 1); c.getItems().addItem(4151, 1); } break;

Read full topic
item.source: Clicking Object and Making Item Appear

item.title: Clicking Object and Making Item Appear
item.dc:creator: @ITI_Basak_ITI ITI Basak ITI
item.description:
@ITI_Basak_ITI wrote:

Just a beginner at coding but I am trying I would like to know how to make it so that when I click on a certain object like a chest, it requires a key to open. When the correct key is in the players inventory, it will open the chest, delete the key, and place 1 of 4 items in the players inventory. I am guessing you do all this in the ClickObject file. This is what I have so far

			case 6420:
			if (c.getItems().playerHasItem(6754,1));
			c.getItems().deleteItem(6754, 1);
			c.getItems().addItem(4151, 1);
			break;

The case that I made allows me to click on the chest and places a whip in my inventory. It also deletes the key (6754) from my inventory if it is there. I want to make the key required because as of right now, it still allows the chest to be clicked on without anything in inventory and it gives a whip.

Please help

Read full topic
item.source: Clicking Object and Making Item Appear
